description: This is my goto cafe after I train Jiu-Jitsu in the Mission/Bernal Heights area. They offer a great variety of sandwiches and salads in addition to the coffee and pastries. I love the openness of the cafe. When it is warm they open up the large windows and you can enjoy the SF air. Seating outside is allowed too in case you want to bring a pet or lively child. Kid-friendly, meeting-friendly and just a very relaxing atmosphere. My fave sandwich is a 29er. I eat it about 2x weekly.
author: Supak C.

description: Maybe like 3.75 ?  Nonchalant service best way to describe it. Quiet inside, reasonable prices, outdoor seats and tables with the public made bench/tables... great to sit outside since it's on a smaller street. Had a sammich, not bad... about $10 to subdue my hunger.
author: Miss J.

description:
I'm a huge fan of Katie's Vegan Eggs (a cold sandwich). Honestly better than real eggs sandwiches I've previously had. The soy lattes are also pretty good (I paid $13 pre-tip for both the sandwich and coffee).

Another bonus is that I've always had space to sit and tables / power outlets for working on your laptop. (Even on Sunday afternoons during peak brunch hours).

I would love to see some other vegan options on the menu!
author: Michael C.

description:
Good cafe in the outskirts of Bernal Heights.

Wifi with caffeine and food items offered on the menu. 

Got their caramel coffee iced and blended! It was good.  

Cash only under 5 bucks. 

Outdoor seating limited and it's great when the weather permits.
author: Tiffany D.

description: Good service, super-tasty sandwiches at good prices, and a friendly neighborhood crowd. Favorite hot paninis: the prosciutto mozzarella and the classic Caprese. Looking for a cold sandwich? You can't go wrong with the curry chicken salad! On a nice day, grab a table outside and watch the mixed Mission-Bernal crowd pass by.
author: David K.

description: What an absolute fab find! Like what everyone else said. Great sandwiches, fantastic service and fab coffee. Limited seating yes. Bleh. Not a cause for any concern. Take it to go if needed. Some outdoor seating when the weather is good. Love the vibe of this place. Great place for a pit stop!
author: Kanwar S.

description:
Stopped in because it was 65 degrees outside in San Francisco, and for those of you not local,  we call that, "freezing." 

I wanted a warm beverage after having dinner at one of my favorite SF restaurants that apparently boycotts turning the heat on in winter and is somehow colder inside than it is outside. (C'MON, pizzahacker! I bought premium toppings. You can afford to put a few logs in the fire.)

So anyway, I stop in and was really just glad to see this coffee shop open at 6:30pm on a Sunday and holiday weekend. I'd been leaning towards a chai but for some reason I blurted out, 'Mexican Hot Chocolate', when the barista asked what I'd like. I did kind of want it and the idea of a spicy dessert-y beverage sounded nice but I had a smidge of FOMO about not getting the chai... then someone pointed out the $5 credit card minimum so I ended up ordering the chai, too, for the my walking mate. 

It wasn't busy at all so they had just one person taking orders, making them, and ringing up. The general vibe is a little low budget and the baked treats on the counter were pretty stale (I got an overly hard dream bar). 

I was excited just to have two hot beverages in my hands to warm up a bit on the way back to my vehicle but bummed that my Mexican hot chocolate was really just a regular old hot chocolate. No spice, nothing stand-out, not everything I was hoping for but hey, it kept me warm for the time being and that was the main goal all along.
author: Candice G.

description:
Great sandwiches - some of the best around. Great bread and super tasty choices, especially if you love toasted sandwiches. 

Overall nice flow in the place - not overrun by computers, just a nice flow of locals and some people working on their laptops. Outdoor seating too!
author: Dee K.

description: Just a cute little unpretentious lunch spot. Their salads and sandwiches are tasty and creative. The staff is friendly. Prices are reasonable.
author: Dana C.

description: Great, local cafe to get your coffee fix or a nice sandwich. Their food is very good, everything is fresh and made to order. The coffee itself is lovely and I really like their selection of non-coffee drinks. Considering how expensive little cafes can be these days, especially in this neighborhood, it's refreshing to see a cafe that has good food and drinks at reasonable prices. No only that but the staff is very friendly, it's genuine  and it shows. Keep kickin butt ladies, wonderful place!
author: Michi R.

description: Nice neighborhood cafe with reasonable prices. I like that they have powder chocolate. The red eye is my go to here.
author: Dan B.

description:
I'll definitely come here again to do some work. I love how the price is slightly cheaper than most cafes in the city. I tried their Breakfast Panini + added ham = about $7. The portion was HUGE. I ate the sandwich for both lunch and dinner. 

They have a wide selection of bagels, pastries, and other beverages. There are several plugs located next to the tables which are nice when you're looking for a place to work. Wifi is strong too! I like how residents come here and make conversations with each other.
author: Christine C.

description:
Everything was really good here; beautiful location, great coffee, yummy bake goods. My one star was for the lady at the counter, chubby girl with glasses.
She handled my "coffee raspberry" cake with her hands and throw it to me in a Togo bag. Classless.
author: Haveagooddayeveryday L.

description: People anxiously sniffing scents of bacon and coffee grinds, peering over each others shoulders, head after head. The bodies snake from the counter across the interior spilling out into the sidewalk parklet into the Saturday morning sunshine. It's so simple, the place. A basic coffee shop cafe- not trying to be anything that it's not. A symbol of a blossoming neighborhood holding onto it's roots.
author: Lindsay L.

description: In visiting some friends in Bernal, stopped here to get a quick coffee before brunch.  Fast service.  Coffee was fine, though the beverage accessory/condiment area was a bit messy.
author: Jeff A.

description:
Such a neighborhood stable! This cafe has a great selection of breakfast items, sandwiches (hot and cold), and salads. With wifi and ample seating, you can definitely spend a couple of hours in here with a sandwich and coffee. Highly recommend:

Breakfast panini with eggs, provolone cheese, tomato, spinach, and a super delicious roasted red pepper mayo - $5.50

Spicy soppressata panini with dry Italian salami, spinach, tomato, onions, and another great spicy jalapeño mayo - $7.25

Dang their mayos are so good.
author: Lucy Z.

description:
I go here every weekend for a bagel and coffee. The employees here are extremely nice and have my order memorized. As soon as I walk into the shop they give me a friendly head-nod and begin making my regular order.

Always super friendly and food + coffee is great!
author: Joseph F.

description: I got a sandwich to go here when I was apartment shopping with a friend. I thought that I would try something new, so I got a brie and apricot jam sandwich on walnut bread. It tasted so good and the portion size was exactly right for an afternoon pick me up. The service was really fast and everyone seemed really nice. I would definitely go back to grab a coffee with an old friend or just to get some work done. They have a lot of seating and cute and cozy booths to sit in!
author: Navya K.

description:
Service: 5 stars
Coffee: 2-3 stars

Service is usually super friendly. They don't know my face but offered to spot my $2 since I didn't have cash on me and there was a credit card minimum. "Just pay us back later when you're in the neighborhood." That's a 5 star experience for a neighborhood cafe! I'll definitely be a returning customer.

The coffee here is amiss sometimes. I've had cappuccino here a few times, and it really depends on the barista you get. I've gotten rough foam and bitter cappuccinos to really smooth and delicious cappuccinos. The house coffee is a good deal and their iced coffee tastes good too. Have to average it to a 3 stars because I really wish they can establish some consistency on the quality of the espresso drinks!
author: Maggie G.

description: Great neighborhood cafe vibe.  Strong coffee that is robust in flavor.  Super dog friendly.
author: J B.

description: My favorite cafe in SF! Prices are reasonable and the staff are always friendly.  Great local spot with delicious coffee and sandwiches. Try the breakfast panini with bacon and you can thank me later!
author: Erica P.

description: Nice vegan veggie Sammy! Fresh and fun. You do need to request the veg to be made vegan. The staff is helpful and supportive!
author: Amy M.

description: I can see why Cafe Seventy8 has such great reviews. You get a really strong cup of coffee here for cheaper than Starbucks or Peet's, so we're talking both quality and quantity. Not only that, their bagels, sandwiches, and salads are all made to order by just two people working the counter and food prep station. It would be a travesty if this local stable goes under or has to close because of gentrification and rising rent in San Francisco. Great service, strong coffee, free wi-fi, delicious food. They even have portable chargers for your phones. Solid stuff. ($5 minimum for credit cards)
author: Danny C.

description:
Quaint little coffee shop in the Bernal Heights area.

Free wifi, nice seats, and more importantly, kick-ass outside seating with blooming cherry blossom trees (where did they get those anyway?). Decent coffee shop to sit, hang out, and chill. The iced coffee was pretty good. Unfortunately, the shop closes quite early though, so unless you live around the area it'll be difficult to visit during open hours.
author: Henry L.

description: They gave me the perfect double macchiato, as requested with all foam. Barista even asked for clarification in a friendly way. Kombucha, morning buns, paninis, bagels. YUM! Local art displayed on the walls.
author: Chris L.

description:
Able to bring bike in. Check
Able to use cards. Check
Unique spicy blend of chai. Check
Healthy impulse buys. Check
Double take on how low the price was. Check 
Outdoor setting. Check
Diverse, interesting crowd. Check
Oh yea and friendly service. Check
author: Mikee C.

description:
Had a hot Prosciutto Mozzarella Panini and a Mocha with almond milk  
The service was great everyone was friendly.
author: Charlotte D.

description: I ordered the prosciutto mozzarella panini. The bread was  warm and extremely crispy. The mozzarella cheese was soft and the prosciutto was cut in thick slices. The arugula gave the entire sandwich an extra kick. The pesto sauce complimented all the other ingredients. However, the tomato was alright.
author: James S.

description: Vegan here: the Katie's vegan Sammy was fuckin' rad. The latte was good too. Great place for vegans to hang with their omni friends. The menu was pretty big. Parking was...shockingly good! Thank you for having so many vegan options, I will be back!
author: Danica N.

description:
Coffee can be easily F'ed up (coffee snob speaking), but this cafe knows how to get the job done. This neighborhood cafe is tucked in the nooks & crannies of the Mission. I was walking on my way to the bus at 6:30 AM & filtered through the cafes that are "Open Now" on Yelp. This spot is great quick stop spot for espresso for your early birds like myself. 

Pluses:
-Coffee isn't overpriced. Double espresso $2.30. I'll take it! 
-Quick Service
-Sweet owner
-Breakfast & Lunch options
author: Alyssaaa S.

description: This is a solid place in bernal/mission. Their sandwiches are awesome. Their coffee is a good price for SF. Good location, comfortable setting...
author: Sara R.

description:
Best. Breakfast bagel. EVER! All the food I've had here has been great, but my husband and I made a tradition of coming for the bacon, egg and cheese breakfast sandwich every weekend :). 

Super friendly staff.
Free wi-fi.
Plenty of seating.
Fast service.

This is the go-to cafe for anyone who lives in the area. They have free dog treats, and while I don't have a dog I enjoy seeing all the dogs in the neighborhood enjoying their free treats :).
author: Claire T.

description:
Cafe Seventy8 occupies a rounded corner spot. food, expresso, wifi, lots of seatiing, and friendly staff. makes this place inviting 

menu: paninis, sammies, muffins, bagels, cookies, pastries
.
brew: (L1.90)
-strong brew, not much character.

drips:
-fascinated, not wowed: many options in this 'hood".
-metered parking
-3.5 stars
author: Victor G.

description: I was surprised by the great reviews for this place. The coffee was OK. My cappuccino looked just like my mom's latte -- so I am not sure what was different about these drinks. What was the most upsetting for me was some of their health practices. I watched the woman take an order, handle money, and then use her hands to pick up a piece of cake and put it on a plate. Tongs are cheap and should be required.
author: Jen G.

description: Cafe Seventy8 is our go-to weekend breakfast and coffee spot. Our order is always the same -- an Americano for me, a Mocha for my wife, and two wheat-everything bagels with bacon/egg/cheddar. They always do an outstanding job, and everyone who works there is so friendly and welcoming. We've loved getting to know Annette and the rest of the Seventy8 crew. On nice warm days, they open up the large side windows to the fresh air -- great way to start the day.
author: Jarred T.

description:
Amazing! The food is so very good and the atmosphere is relaxed and inviting. There was a massive rush going on when I stopped in but the staff kept the line moving and my food came out very quick. 
I had the TBA sandwich and the toasted bread was crunchy and delicious. All the toppings were fresh and came together beautifully.
author: Heather S.

description: The food is good and the people who work here are very nice but there Teally needs to be one more person working during the lunch hour. Only two people, one cooking and one cashier...not enough! Long line makes a quick bite not so quick.
author: Dee C.

description: Annette and her awesome, happy, helpful, and welcoming staff are the best. Food is always on point, coffee is great, snacks and pastries are delicious and the revolving door of friendly neighbors is wonderful to be around. A neighborhood staple!
author: Otto M.

description: Conveniently located half a block from Mission street, I've been to this cafe a few times on my way to work in the neighborhood. The cafe has staff who are friendly and upbeat, serves a variety of caffeinated drinks for your morning fix, and has delicious breakfast sandwiches! My only issue is sometimes getting stuck in the long line of other people who love this place.
author: Shav S.

description:
I'm a big fan of this cafe. The first time (and definitely not the last) I came here, I had a cappuccino and a breakfast panini. My girlfriend had a fruit and yogurt partait and coffee.

My cappuccino had a perfectly thick head of foam on top -- made just the way a cappuccino should (unless you texture the milk instead, which is also a good option) -- and was delicious. As we sat down to enjoy our coffee, I could smell the breakfast panini coming. It was savory, gooey and just the thing I needed to get me going that morning.

Overall, it was a perfect place for breakfast and I will be coming back.
author: Jeremy G.

description: My fav coffee spot , bagel with sundried TOMATO cream cheese is the best! Coffee always on point
author: Ruben R.

description:
Great breakfast bagels and sandwiches and your typical coffee. The 29er is definitely one of my favorite breakfast bagels.

The service was good but we had a little confusion with picking up our orders. If you are like me and don't usually grab the receipt, make sure you do here beause they call out assigned order numbers instead of names or food items.
author: Jason X.

description: I really like their coffee.   Go here 2-4 times per week.  Curry chicken salad sandwich is also yummy.  Everyone there is friendly.   Great neighborhood cafe.
author: Zachary P.

description:
Cafe 78 is an absolute gem.  I've been enjoying this place for years and it never disappoints.  Friendly people, creative vibe and the Blue Turkey panini sandwich has changed my life.  

ps I'm not a frequent Yelper but this place more than deserves a shout out.  Enjoy!
author: Anne M.

description: Great service, good coffee, I get the 29er for a solid lunch under 5 bucks. Worth a visit!
author: Jordan R.

description: Awesome breakfast panini! Friendly staff, they remembered me after a couple of years.  Highly recommended!
author: Kevin L.

description: I had an iced latte with the Heavenly Veggie and my boyfriend had a blended iced mocha with a Blue Turkey panini. The iced latte was one of the best I've had since being in San Francisco. They don't burn the coffee!!  The sandwiches are very fresh and tasty. The people behind the counter are very friendly and work hard to get the orders out quickly. We're glad we stumbled upon this place!!
author: Janell G.

description:
There's nothing amazing enough about Cafe Seventy8 to be worth five stars, but they have a very friendly atmosphere good for reading or working on your laptop, make very good coffee, and solid sandwiches.  

Sandwiches are all around $7, which is slightly pricey for what you get, but inline for a high end hipster cafe -- my favorite is the hot sandwich "Blue Turkey" -- turkey w/blue cheese, walnuts, spinach, tomato, and red pepper mayo.  

Mochas are also a highlight, and they get their pastries from various local bakeries.
author: Zachary R.

description:
The one thing I miss the most about living in that corner of the city is Cafe Seventy8! Staff is always friendly, and the quality is very consistent.

My picks are the double cappuccino and the spicy soppressata sandwich. Can't go wrong with that!
author: Johannes W.

description:
Tip: If I order iced coffee and you put it in a hot-from-the-dishwasher glass so that all the ice immediately melts, please don't give me attitude when, after waiting politely while you chat with your hip co-worker and studiously ignore customers, I request more ice, which you also put in a hot glass, leaving me with tepid colored water, which is only one of the bad tastes in my mouth. 

Bottom line: I tipped $1.00 for a $2.00 brown water with attitude?
author: Faith A.

description:
I feel really lucky to live near this place. The lowdown:

1. The bagel sandwiches are outstanding. I get an egg and cheese there pretty regularly and if God made bagel sandwiches, I'm pretty sure this is what they'd taste like. Soft, yet firm. A hint of salt, just the right meltiness of cheese. Wow, I want a bagel sandwich right now. (Beware, though, that they will run out of bagels by midday - particularly on weekends- so don't wait too long.)

2. My soy latte is always smooth and a pleasure to drink.

3. The bananas are perfect. Does it make sense to compliment a cafe on their fruit selection? It's weird. I've never seen such consistently perfect banana offerings. Every time I go in, the bananas are perfectly ripe and yellow and pretty and big (there's a joke in there somewhere which I refuse to make).

4. Staff is always friendly and majority vaguely European. Sometimes they play the Amelie soundtrack and I feel all french to be in there.

Minor things to note:
1. They often keep the door open, even if it's cold. If you're sensitive to temperature and plan to work there, you might want to bring a coat.

2. The splenda is hidden in a cup at the counter. They'll give it to you if you ask for it. Not sure why there is splenda rationing/isolation from the other artificial sweeteners (which are in the bucket by the door), but thought it might be worth mentioning.
author: Zika R.

description:
This cafe rocks ... from the super cool owners and employees, to the open space and public parklet out front, to the deliciously made coffee, and sandwiches ... my favorite is the ultimate veggie ... SO YUMMY!!!

They also make great breakfast sandwiches and salads for lunch ... check it out!!!

Also, they're constantly changing up the cool artwork in there ... it's a hot spot for community activity too ...
author: Kelli M.

description: I have been coming here for quite some time and the 5 stars is for their sandwiches. They are super simple but soooooo GOOD!  I usually get the prociutto and mozzarella, but yesterday I decided to get the caprese sandwich. I was in heaven. So simple, but delish!  I think it was just mozzarella cheese, basil, some green olives, a special mayo and...not sure what else, but I was freakin delicious.  They have really good breakfast Panini's as well.  If your in the neighborhood and want a quick bite to eat, maybe craving a sandwich, this place is definitely worth a try.
author: LuLu M.

description: A cool neighborly joint. Went here whilst waiting for a seat at Ichi to open up. My soy chai was just the right kind of spicy. The barista dude was cool and legit.
author: Andrew K.

description:
The "Katie's Vegan Eggs" sandwhich is amazing! Add avocado for an extra amazingness punch. 
Also, their fresh juice is to die for. 
A great vegan lunch.
author: Liz H.

description:
I am sitting here on my laptop with Free wireless eating the most delicious sandwich in the city.  I ordered the "Heavenly Veggie" Panini and it is fantastic.  I love this cafe.  People are nice; they don't rush you out; and it's a local place where anyone and everyone is welcome.  

If you haven't come by, try to visit it, and if you like vegetarian, don't miss the Heavenly Veggie Panini!
author: Nancy W.

description: Nice spot for a coffee shop in this area, the staff here are friendly and efficient. I came in and ordered a Singe Mocha, it tasted good. I'll be back to try another menu item when I am in the area.
author: Bennett W.

description:
My go to coffee. Perfect location for me, great interior, sunny, chill, good music, great simple food.

Their Americanos can taste a little watered down sometimes, but I haven't had that problem recently.

I've had something like 90782340897234789023 coffees here.
author: Jeff M.

description:
such a great place. I'm currently sitting next to an elderly retired woman, who is using two tables to do her TMT exercises while watching  her computer, she's got one table just for her USB mouse. 

She's been here for hours and she DID NOT PURCHASE ANYTHING! such great folks but really, we should buy something to support these businesses. Sure, I set up office here sometimes too, but I always buy an amazing sandwich or yummy soup. 

I can't believe how nice this place is.
xoxox
author: shanestar h.

description: What more can you ask for?  This place has several bike racks out front, wifi, great chai latte, it's on a cute corner in a cute neighborhood and the folks here are super nice n' friendly.  To top it off I got the comfy chair in the far corner where I'm writing this review.  So glad I picked this place!
author: Elena I.

description: I'm obsessed with their paninis and breakfast sandwiches. This place is solid. Chai lattes are pretty good too.
author: Aileen J.

description:
I'm so happy this place is my local cafe! Right around the corner from my house. 

Great prices, AWESOME staff (so kind, genuine, and funny), really amazing prices. Their products are high quality and compared to the rest of the city this place seems like a steal. I love that the cafe has a really diverse customer base and that there aren't 20 people with Macbooks taking up every table for hours. I often come here to eat lunch and to read and relax.

I love the breakfast panini - eggs, spinach, roasted red pepper mayo, tomatoes and cheese on ciabatta then toasted. For only $4.50? Love it. This is my official hangover breakfast. 

My favorite sandwich is the blue turkey. Turkey, blue cheese, walnuts, and spinach. I've never seen walnuts on a sandwich before and it's super tasty. 

Their baked goods are pretty good as well, and someday I gotta try an empanada. 

The parklet outside is a nice place to sit and watch people go by, walking their dogs. It's a very friendly atmosphere and makes the city feel more small town-y. 

Thanks for being so awesome, Cafe 78. Love you guys.
author: Laura K.

description:
I have really only been here a few times, mainly en route to the post office.  The servers here are always friendly.  I like the vegan egg salad but I have to get it very salt-and-peppery.  They have lots of nice teas and sweet treats.  There is a little parklet outside now, which is great if your dog is like mine and loves to sunbathe more than George Hamilton.

Also, I saw an actor from "The Wire" here once.
author: Sophia R.

description:
Please stop reading this review.  Don't go to this cafe.  It's so good that I don't want you creating lines there.

Perfect coffee yes. But amazing panini sandwiches too.  I don't know of any other coffee shop that does paninis like Seventy8.  I had some American friends who live in Germany visiting--we had to eat there at least once per day, sometimes twice.  Stay away from the Clucker and the Vege Delight, they don't have enough for you- go away!

I literally tried every coffee shop within walking distance of Seventy8--none of them has a coffee-sandwich-price ratio that compares.
author: Kevin C.

description:
Breakfast whites. Cookie rumors.

Egg white panini was made exactly to order. One of the few times I could have used less egg and more veggies. Six bucks was fair.

Coffee was good but unfortunately served in a hot hot hot glass. Could have used a mug.

Both enjoyed using the free Internet.

Chocolate cookies available on select days if you are lucky. Not going to share when those days are. Sorry yelpers!

(not really)
author: Jason B.

description: I love this place. I checked out many coffee shops in the area since moving to SF and this has by far been the best so far. The service is great and the ladies working here are always smiling and genuinely happy. That alone makes me like this place, but this place has great coffee and food, including bagels, which seems hard to find around here. See you tomorrow Cafe Seventy8!
author: Jordan B.

description:
I am not an avid Yelper, but I have come here to spread the good word of Cafe Seventy8.

I arrived in the neighborhood in August of 2013, moving in with my boyfriend from the distant tundra we know and love as New England. Bleary-eyed and weary from the long road behind me, I spotted this haven of caffeine on my block. I stumbled in, and likely muttered something incoherent about soy milk.

Months later, and I go virtually nowhere else for the iced coffee I require to function on a semi-human level. Tasty coffee, affordable breakfast, and fantastic service. The art on the walls changes frequently, giving my tired mind something to do before Annette (owner and barista extraordinaire, the lady makes a mean dirty chai!) or her employees greet me with a smile, my iced coffee waiting for me on the counter, soy milk standing at the ready beside it.

Suck it, Starbucks. Stop in here for your morning caffeine concoction and leave happy!
author: M.K. C.

description:
No frills coffee joint, that is also very kid friendly (i.e. toys littered about to keep the kiddies distracted while their moms chit chat and catch up). 

I can't help but like a place that serves their White Chocolate Mochas in a pint glass with a cardboard coffee cup grip around it.  And a damned tasty white mocha at that.  I don't know why, but it just makes me smile.
author: mariel v.

description:
Moved to the neighborhood a few months ago and one morning I was in a desperate search for some caffeine, looked at yelp and found Cafe Seventy8 and I'm glad I did!  It is a nice, comfortable cafe with friendly employees.  I enjoy their coffee and other drinks and they have good food.  

It has now become my standard routine to start my Saturdays and Sundays by going to Cafe Seventy8 for coffee and a bagel.
author: Tony H.

description: Very friendly cafe! Lots of wonderful people, great coffee, yummy self made peanut butter cups. Great wifi connection. Love hanging out here!
author: Daib S.

description: They make me a soy latte here almost everyday, and subsequently, it makes my day.
author: Natalie R.

description:
These peeps are passionate about their paninis! Flavorfully designed, creatively assembled, and timely prepared there is no way that you can go wrong with a breakfast panini or a Blue Turkey or a Heavenly Veggie at this spot! Delicious coffee sourced from a San Francisco roaster! With the usual milk suspects - regular, soy, almond. 
If you have a sweet tooth go for the lemon bar (absolutely mouth watering) and/or the coconut vegan cookies! Amazeballs - even if you're not vegan! 

Vegan options for bagels and sandwiches + super friendly with substitutions and such! 

Free dog treats, free wifi and a post office around the corner! 

Love this place
author: Rana A.

description:
I might be biased in writing this review because this is my neighborhood 'spot' but I have to give a lot of praise to this coffee shop. 

I get a small coffee here a couple of times a week as it is the perfect strength and flavor to suit my tastes. I generally don't have food but have had bagel sandwiches and scones on occasion; they have always been good and are extremely reasonably priced. 

The vibe is really comfortable - not too pretentious but with a certain amount of edge. It has never been too crowded to find a table and patrons are allowed to sit for as long as they want. The servers are always friendly and seem like rad people!
author: Maggie J.

description: My boyfriend and I stayed in Bernal Heights for a few days recently and on our final walk to Mission before heading to the airport, we stopped at 78 for coffee and some breakfast sandwiches. I wish we'd stopped here the first day because we would have returned again and again. He had a chicken sandwich, I had the strawberries and Nutella sandwich (on walnut bread). It was out of this world yummy and made me feel like a little kid - Nutella!!. The coffee, both regular and decaf was delicious. The vibe was really casual and very comfortable. The space is sunny and well-decorated.
author: Ana R.

description: A-MA-ZING!  This is a great neighborhood coffee shop.  Free Wifi.  Great Staff.  Lots of seating without a rush.  Fun music.  Also lots of sandwiches and salads for carnivores, vegetarians, and vegans.  The coffee is good and this is really a great place to meet friends, hang out and study, or just grab and go.  Go again and again!
author: Mark E.

description:
When I first moved to the area, I was staying just around the corner from this cafe. Hands down, the BEST white mocha I've ever had. I've since moved to the East Bay, and haven't had one yet that is as good :/

Also, their sandwiches are the so, so good. I like the salami one with spicy spread! Yumm! I always try to swing by if I'm in the city because the people who work there, and hang out there are always so nice!
author: Emily H.

description:
While walking towards Mitchell's, it was a bit chilly so I stopped here first for a warm up.  It's a nice inviting place with a lot to offer.  You can order sandwiches, paninni's, and bagel sandwiches, as well as a lot of pastries and cookies.

I have yet to try the sandwiches, but I will be back to try them out.  For now, all I can tell you about is the coffee.  I used my usual gauge for a coffee shop ... a four shot mocha.  I thought it was on the sweet side but it had a good flavor to it.  Next time I will cut down on the cocoa or just regular coffee.

It's not quite my usual spot nearby, but I will go back to give the rest of the menu a try.  Nice seating outside if you can brave the breeze.
author: Michael M.

description: Good coffee and service here. First time trying their food. They have a variety of sandwiches on fresh bread. Had the breakfast panini.
author: Darren K.

description: The people that work here are so nice and patient when I am trying to make up my mind on what I want to order.  The coffee is strong and good.  The sandwiches never disappoint.  I love all of the sandwiches but my favorite is the heavenly veggie...it's amazing and I am not a vegetarian.  There is always somewhere to sit inside or outside and I feel like I can stay and hang out for a while if I want to.  Definitely one of my favorite lunch spots.
author: Amelia C.

description:
Amazing cafe!  Every time I drag my tired butt into their doors, I am always greeted with great customer service and entertaining humor.  Upon my third visit the staff not only ran on with some jokes but remembered the last time I stumbled on in.

The coffee is delicious and their Blue Cheese Turkey Panini is amazing!
author: Francesca H.

description:
I want to like this place so so bad.  The women who work there are really great.  They host neighborhood events, know almost everyone, and make small talk.

Great sandwiches and decent selection of sweets... but it's a cafe and their coffee is mediocre at best.  Please please please change your roaster.  I want to want you but right now all I do is settle for you when I'm too lazy to venture out any farther...
author: Sandy S.

description:
I'm not much of a coffee person, but I do know my sammy's...and these are some of the neighborhoods best!!  I have walked by here a million times and just thought it was another coffee shop, but then I was craving a sammy so I decided to go in.   I got one with turkey, jalapeno mayo, bacon, the works...and it was just heavenly.  Plus, I got a delicious glass of fresh squeezed OJ!  Pretty affordable too.  

I feel I cannot give this place 5 stars without trying the coffee, but I will absolutely be back.  I'm so glad to have a legit place in my neighborhood to get a sammy that's not safeway.  Thanks seventy8!
author: Sara S.

description:
I really love this place. Why? Because they really know what you want here. You come and say, I don't know what I want to eat, they ask you immediately what you're having for dinner (god help you if you don't know the answer to that question I suppose) and then tell you what you should have for lunch. So far, they haven't been wrong a single time.

They make great coffee, have good sweets, amazing home made dressing for salads (which are quite LARGE for the $$) and their sandwiches are good to boot as well.

Oh, and that minor thing of being nice to your customers too. It's also nice that they have free WiFi available as well. Though I suppose a lot of places are offering that as well.
author: Amar K.

description: Spent almost the entire day here working while my car was with the mechanic nearby,,,it was great! Nice selection of tasty food and drink, free wifi, electric outlets a-plenty (tho you have to kinda crawl under the benches to reach them), and low-playing and non-irritating music in the background. A steady stream of customers came in throughout the day, but it was never so crazy busy that it was ever difficult to focus on my work. Excellent work-away-from-the-office spot.
author: Catherine H.

description: The staff is always friendly. They have a nice menu with sandwiches and other food, as well as various drinks. It's a nice place to work as they have WIFI.  There's a park-let out front if you want to enjoy the sun.  It's right off of the 14 and 49 lines, and close to several others including the J Church.
author: Marni S.

description:
Cafe Seventy8, I don't know what I would do without you.  We eat here about 4 times a week, sometimes more.  Their sandwiches are the best in the neighborhood, hands down.  It's quite unexpected to have such a delicious selection of fresh food in such a small, hidden gem of a coffee shop- just give it a try, you'll love it!  The heavenly veggie and the Katie's Vegan Eggs (with extra mustard) are honestly some of the best vegetarian sandwiches I have had in the city.  I also love that they carry House Kombucha, Ginger Beer and Root Beer- 3 of my favorite beverages.  The ladies are always super friendly and fast with zero attitude.  I feel at home when I'm here.  I would give them 5 stars but their coffee is just ok (and I'm a coffee snob doncha know).  If they started brewing Blue Bottle or Ritual I would easily dub this the greatest coffee shop in the city.  

I'm headed there now...
author: Alli J.

description: I went here with a friend of mine who lives in the neighborhood.  We didn't get coffee, but had lunch there instead.  I had the hot panini sandwich with brie which was really pretty good, but a little heavy on the brie.  Definitely recommend this place for a good bite to eat though!  Great atmosphere for sitting and having a conversation.  The staff also seemed very friendly and welcoming which is always a plus!
author: Emily T.

description: Great, no-nonsense cafe which isn't a scene. Clean inside. Wifi works. Nice employees. Some of the music choices I've heard are questionable, but you can always retreat to the adjacent parklet.
author: Paul K.

description:
Lovely neighborhood (cash only) coffee shop. 

Lots of goodies, I had carrot cake for breakfast the other day. =)

I love their salami sandwich on an olive baguette with red pepper mayo, and cream cheese!

They have a bunch of tables outside too.
author: Michelle W.

description: everybody here is always very friendly! the breakfast panini and california dreamin' bagels are my faves! super yummy. sometimes the wait is a bit long but it is worth the wait that I still keep coming back.
author: S P.

description:
I've been coming here regularly to work on my computer for 1.5 years. It's a home away from home and I can't say enough good things about it. It's all I could want in a neighborhood coffee shop. 

Workers are friendly, hardworking, get along very well together, and make customers feel comfortable and relaxed. It's hard to describe a vibe. I just feel very at home here. 

The coffee is my favorite in the neighborhood. They also have a great tea selection. I love the sandwiches, bagels, and baked goods too. The chairs are comfortable, it feels open and bright, plenty of outlets, self-serve water, and free wi-fi. They have completely won my loyalty.

And baby/kid friendly with a rack of toys and a little toddler table. Great music and rotation of artwork. They have tables outside and there is a parklet and bike parking. They've thought of everything!
author: K. C.

description: Gorgeous cafe with lots of indoor & outdoor seating, relaxed atmosphere, great variety of coffee, juice & snacks
author: Robin H.

description:
Quieting.  Hidden.  Legit.

What's up with these hidden cafe's in the Mission?! I fortuitously stumbled upon Cafe Seventy8 (anyone know the history behind the name?) craving a warm bev and assessed upon first glance that this place was gonna do me right: clean, spacious, and freshly baked goodies neatly on display.

One star knock off for false advertisement (best chocolate chip cookies in town?  hmm...read: anthony's?)  but who's counting...so I got one anyway - not bad!

The coffee was arguably the freshest brew I've had in quite some time.  My beautiful Barcelonean(?) barista also made sure I had just enough room for milk and the temp was perfect!  Sippable, not gulpable, and def not scorching.  

The red velvet cake looked scrumptious and I was equally impressed with the barista who constantly kept herself busy tidying up the area (I was there for 2 hours!)

Caffeine fiends!  Go discover this hidden treasure!

$1.50 for cuppa joe
$.75 med size cookie

**Board games avail!
author: Jane L.

description:
Really an amazing neighborhood feel. People wander in, get hailed by the baristas by name, have conversations with other customers they know. People bring their kids and their dogs. It doubles as a quasi art-gallery, since the art on the walls is all by local artists and is always changing. I really enjoy seeing the work and reading the artists statement everytime it changes. The food menu is small, but everything they make is really good, and well priced.

Great place to do work on a laptop, lots of plugs and tables. One star off because they frequently leave the doors propped open, likely to facilitate the open, neighborhood feel. I don't fault them for that at all, it makes it welcoming and easy for customers to meander in, but in the colder months (which is most of the time around here) it can get pretty cold, especially if youre sitting stationary at a laptop for awhile. In the warmer months, though, they can slide open their large windows along the west wall and its absolutely breezy and wonderful.
author: Colleen O.

description: I love this place. This is my neighborhood hang spot. Totally kid friendly, they even have a high chair-- at a coffee house?!?! AMAZING! Not to mention their tuna sandwich is out of control delish! And I love their bagel sandwiches. I've never had a bad sandwich.
author: Jessa B.

description:
This is my neighborhood cafe by my house. The panini sandwiches here are wonderful - there are times when I try to rush home after work to try to get in a sandwich order before they close at 7 pm.   The new owners, Annette and crew, are very friendly and are doing a great job of making this the local hangout spot where you can say hi to neighbors.  

The space is airy with giant windows that they open on warm days. They also have a collection of seats outside when you want to get some sun.  But if you sit outside, take your trash back inside please:)
author: Joyce K.

description:
Know what's my biggest pet peeve?  

When establishments don't have "cash only" signs, resulting into me handing over my credit card after making my order and the cashier going, "Sorry, we take only cash.  There's an ATM around the corner/over there/one block away/etc. so you have to go and pay a $2.00 fee instead of being properly notified ahead of time and passing up on us for another place that takes cards."  

Situations like this make me suspect that some establishments have a deal with ATM companies where they force their customers to use a nearby ATM and to pay a withdrawal fee in order to cough up cash for their order.

So, yes.  That's precisely what happened when I came here.  Although I was considerably annoyed, my bagel, which was reasonably priced, and carrot cake were delicious.  The two women behind the counter were really nice, too.

I'd recommend this place, but you have to remember to BRING CASH.  Don't let the evil ATM company win!
author: Chiara H.

description:
Liked the staff, it's sunny location and the others who were hanging here, but...

the drip coffee was horrible. Too light-bodied and tasted old. Perhaps I caught a bad (or expired) batch, but it had me craving Folger's. I took it to go and, despite eventually thowing out half of it, considered replacing it when I passed by Nervous Dog a few blocks later.

This place is near-ish my apartment so I want to like it.  I'll give it a second try in hopes I just caught a bad brew today. I see potential.
author: Daniel P.

description: Nice to have large tables and WiFi to enjoy, but the music is horrible and too loud (I am in my early 30s and not too stodgy, I swear). Also, someone else pointed out the thing about the door being open even when it is cold. He was right on.
author: A H.

description: Aww - just got the purtiest Moncha ever! Wished I'd taken a picture. Somebody in line said it looked like a pictograph on top of my Mocha. Thank you, Cafe Seventy8 (and the barista with the long blonde hair) for making my day!
author: maureen f.

description:
I love going to Cafe Seventy8 in a sunny day to enjoy the strong coffee they serve... and the paninis! People working there are very nice and friendly, and make a good job at making the Cafe welcoming! 
The coffee is good, the home-made cookies better!
author: martha s.

description: Everything you want in a coffee shop and then some - great coffees, great sandwiches and salads and most importantly super nice owner and staff.  Our go to coffee shop.  Also love that they have a kids play area with books and toys and trashy magazines.
author: Danielle M.

description: Good sandwiches, pastries, and other eats, though often packed, so seating can be a chore. Not that great a corner to sit out on.
author: Hella Stella Y.

description: Tasty peanut butter cookies. Pleasant staff.
author: Inigo M.

description:
Love the coffee, the baristas, and the all over vibe.  

Don't like that they don't take ATM cards.  Not really interested in paying an additional fee at an ATM within the cafe, and being a person who doesn't carry much cash, I often find myself at Nervous Dog Cafe which isn't nearly as good, but more convenient.
author: Trisha I.

description:
Love love love this place.  The service is *top* notch - zero 'tude, always happy and inviting.  I've only had the tea (with foamy soy) and the foam is always done to perfection.  

The cafe itself is spacious, with ample room to put your stuff down and chill.  It never seems to get too crowded there, which is what I like about it!  Also, there are full-wall windows on both sides, and since it sits on a corner, there is a ton of natural light coming in - as well as lots of space to people watch.

Love this joint.
author: Jessie S.

description: Simple cafe with friendly owners and lots of toys for kids.
author: Mark C.

description: I absolutely love this place! It is very well taken care of, coffee is perfect ... and try the sandwiches!
author: Alex C.

description: Amazing menu! All the best ingredients including brie and avocado.. Will definitely be back!
author: Jasmine G.

description: If you're looking for a good cafe to work in, this is the spot in Bernal. The wifi is reliable, the place is usually pretty quiet, there is no shortage of plugs, and the music is unobtrusive (except sometimes they binge on melodramatic Piaf chansons). And it's not one of those places where you order your coffee and then can't find a seat. A bit dreary inside, and the orange juice is definitely not fresh squeezed (even though packaged that way)--otherwise I'd give five stars.
author: B G.

description: How have I missed this coffee shop for so long? I've lived just around the corner for three years but only found out about this spot when I finally found the local post office (which also took me way too long to do).  The coffee is great. The sandwiches are great.  That is all I want in a sandwich-serving coffee shop.
author: J S.

description:
Yummy panini, and they've got Mexican Coke. Good wi-fi signal. Nice place to chill. Cute foreign barista girls.

But there are too many flies inside and it isn't open late enough.
author: Stu M.

description: The veggie (sans tomato) panini is so good Im addicted to them. Carrot cake was pretty good also. And its nice, clean, friendly, all that good stuff.
author: Jennie S.

description:
Pluses: quick friendly service, soy latte good flavor, Kerri's Kreations vegan cookies, clean bathroom.
Minuses: all hard seating, not much of a vibe, not much in the way of people watching on the street
author: Bob G.

description: The staff is OK, not great and the coffee that I had was hyperloaded, couldn't drink it at all.
author: Gerardo C.

description: Great menu. A bit slow service but within reason.
author: Alex G.

description:
I love this place!  

It used to be the Muddy Waters coffee shop in Bernal Heights but it is under new ownership and renamed Cafe 78.
They serve delicious paninis and reeeally good coffee drinks along with these amazing homemade baked cookies and banana nut bread.  

I come here almost every day that I can to work on my websites etc. ;)

Check it out! Especially if you live in the area!
author: Amy K.

description: Greatest neighborhood cafe you could ask for. They know my coffee order on sight, make the absolutely best bagel sandwiches ever, and are super friendly to dogs and kids who come by. There are lots of good reasons this place is always busy. And there's even a little parklet outside!
author: Saket V.

description: Megan from Noe Valley is going to bring me a mocha from the cafe. I from Bernal Depths, have already had a cappuccino this morning. How convenient that this cafe is located in the perfect middle. Just off loud crazy Mission street, Seventy8 is a respite. The baristas, a friendly combination of German lesbian and earthy Mission, engage both my daughter and my dog, offering each a treat. The coffee is okay-- it does what it needs to do-- if you want inspiration you're going to have to go wait in that long line at Ritual down the street. They also make decent sandwiches and their line of kombucha tastes especially virtuous.
author: Jenny D.

description:
it's still the best cafe in my opinion! service, quality, price...its all just perfectly right.
they have gotten much busier, and at times it's not as easy anymore to find a table....i wont hold it against them though....
author: Emliy H.

description: I got the chai tea latte which was not that good.  It was a bit watery tasting.  Also, the lady who made my chai tea was eating while making my drink which kinda weirded me out.  Probably won't be coming back.
author: Christina B.

description: Friends put us up for the night and when we asked where we could get a cheap breakfast in the morning they pointed us here. If I lived in San Francisco I would be here most mornings. We both had the breakfast panini and were satisfied until our midmorning snack at the Japanese Tea Garden. Since neither of us are big on coffee and it is a cafe, I cannot offer up the coveted 5th star. I defer to the coffee experts... However! If you want a quick, cheap, and delicious meal I do recommend them quite highly!
author: Ian J.

description: it took me a while to start patronizing this place, but now that I do I wouldn't go anywhere else. The two best things about this place is the coffee (which is grrreat) and the staff are so friendly and accommodating. I mostly go for the coffee but once in a while I order a breakfast bagel or bfast panini. All the food, including the desserts are fantastic. I highly recommend this place.
author: Lin N.

description: i love this cafe, it's my go to cafe to study or grab a quick breakfast or lunch. the sandwich are excellent. the sauce are hand made and their delicious. i love my prosciutto mozzarella with pesto sandwich, they always make it so perfect. besides the food, employees are friendly and great atmosphere.
author: Toni Rose M.

description: I love this place.  It's convenient to my office, and has lots of vegan options.  Their coffee and chai, my regular drinks, are mediocre at best, but I'm willing to deal with that for the convenience.  My biggest pet peeve is that they are constantly out of stuff.  Today I went at noon for a couple bagel sandwiches for me and my co-workers.  They were out of bagels.  Granted there may have been a breakfast rush, but their yummy bagel sandwiches take up about half of their menu, and are perfect for lunch.  If it had been 5 p.m., I would have understood-well, maybe.  We live in SF, not the boonies...if you're out of something, go get it, rather than risk turning off your customers.
author: Yogini R.

description: Cafe Seventy8 has totally yummy vegan cookies and vegan "egg salad" sandwiches.  They've got a wonderful neighborhood feeling, the kind of place where neighbors come in with their dogs and chat about what's happening with the Tiffany Street "traffic calming" or Friends of the Urban Forest sidewalk planting or the St. Luke's hospital renovations.  Cafe Seventy8 even provides space (after hours) for the Neighborhood Watch meetings, which is very cool.  The folks behind the counter are friendly and helpful, and the ambiance is great for grabbing a quick bite or staying for awhile with a good book or newspaper, or doing some work on your laptop.
author: Rachel D.

description: I think Cafe 78 has good food and good service! The people there are really nice and don't mind misbehaved dogs(like mine). I also think they have a good range of prices.
author: Lily B.

description:
Great food, great prices, great service.  And I'm not just saying that, or a friend of the workers.  It truly is all that and more.  Highly recommend!


UPDATE

A couple of suggestions:

1) It would be nice if you had a non-dairy creamer like soy, rice, or almond milk.

2) Please provide unrefined sugar also.  It is not the C&H type brown sugar that is currently provided, it is unprocessed sugar that just happens to be brownish in color.

Visit Four Barrel on Valencia for an example.
author: Customer X.

description: I love the new owners and staff of Cafe Seventy8. The new interior also makes the place more inviting and it just seems cleaner. I have coffee and an egg and bagel sando about 3 times a week . The food quality is great and they knock it out pretty quick. Stop by and check out the difference--it ain't Muddy Waters no mo.
author: Deborah S.

description: Anett is the best , always there to serve you a delicious coffee drink with awesome goodies in the morning. Great staff as well , love the place. Great selection of music too .
author: Philippe B.

description: A super-friendly neighborly vibe is going on here! Food and coffee is solid, if not fancy. Staff is nice and chatty.
author: Jennifer O.

description:
This is a great little coffee shop. Not pretentious, not grungy, but a nice little spot in the middle I call comfortable. They have good coffee and good snacks, and a very relaxed clientele. 

I went in this morning as I often do on Saturdays, but having stumbled out of the house with only a $5 was $0.25 short for the order I wanted to place. No problem, they were happy to overlook that quarter. Next time, will certainly make up for it with a nicer-than-usual tip. 

All in all, fantastic neighborhood coffee joint.
author: i p.

description:
super consistent and delicious coffee, iced coffee, bagels and panini.  the baby ham panini on seeded sourdough--grilled and scrumptious.  awesome ladies with just a little attitude--not too much.

what really prompted this review was my latest discovery: the veggie panini.  sounds like it could be random crap, but they make it FAT--avocado, brie, red onions, and some other yummy things.

plus they're right next to the mailbox.  perfect cheap brekky or lunch stop with easy walking or parking.
author: threeholepunch y.

description: Revised-I never changed my opinion of the quality of the coffee and food, but it seems like they took care of the dog issue and have been very friendly about it. I'm back regularly.
author: M B.

description: I love this place. It's women-owned and run.  All of their sandwiches are tasty and super fresh.  I'm a sucker for the cookies, which I believe are homemade in the neighborhood.  Sometimes my puppy Betty joins for one of the homemade dog treats (in the shape of 7s and 8s!).  The coffee is great, the wireless is solid, there's outside seating, and 0 pretentiousness. what else could a girl ask for? just katie's vegan egg sandwich!
author: Cat F.

description: One of my very favorite coffee shops of all time! Regulars here range in age from in-utero to over 80-yrs-old, and everyone is welcome. I routinely hear three or more languages while I'm there in the morning. Annette subscribes to the Economist and the New York Times as well as the Chronicle, so there's always something fun to read. The food is terrific, the coffee is yummy, and the rotating art installations give you a good place to rest your eyes. Dogs are invited in to visit, too--there's a jar of free dog biscuits, and usually someone willing to toss one in the air for your pooch to catch. Have I mentioned that I love it? LOVE IT.
author: Rose W.

description: This place is great! I call in my order once a week for lunch and it's always ready to go when I get there. They're accommodating with my requested changes to my favorite panini (I get the veggie one - SO good!!) and are consistently super sweet. And the treats on the counter are hella tempting and totally worth it every time I give in. Check it out!
author: Cathy V.

description: I've been in the city for two years now and this is still my favorite coffee shop!!!  Great atmosphere for getting work done if you're coming to study or work, great new little outdoor seating area, and all of the staff are very pleasant.  The food is always delicious with a good variety of breakfast, sandwiched, and salads.  They even have a couple delicious vegan options.  The best part however is the coffee!!!  It's good and strong!  I'm a straight forward cup a joe gal but whe I do want a latte, this place makes them the best!
author: tarrah c.

description:
I say A-Ok because I knew/hung-out/studied-at/noshed at this coffee house waaaayyy before it became Cafe 78. The new owners changd the name. This used to be Muddy Waters (or Muddy's to locals). Muddy's is a chain with cafes at 24th and Valencia, Church St., 16th and Valencia, and I think another spot. Cafe 78 is a little bit more chic (?) than Muddy's. Muddy's was a little more on the down-low and had the basics (bagels, pastries, juice, soda, and of course, coffee).  Cafe 78 has paninis (sp?), salads, desserts, pastries, juice, yogurt parfaits, etc. I haven't been to Cafe 78 for a while to study, except just recently, only because I'm done taking all the heavy-loaded classes for pre-nursing. Otherwise, my a$$ would be parked at Cafe 78 almost 7 days a week after work and on weekends studying. That might change next semester though, so I just might be a semi-permanent fixture at Cafe 78 as I was when it used to be Muddy's. 

I recently ran into my co-worker over the past weekend in here and he was shocked to find me studying there =). I told him once, after the new owners took over, that this cafe has become a little too chi-chi for me =D. I might have to hang-out more at this cafe again to rethink that. I like that they've added more food selections besides the usual bagels and pastries and they've added tables outside, so people inside studying/on their lap tops have somewhere to sit. 

Give me one more week and I just might add another star or two. Sorry, I'm local and I'm not really to happy about  the many changes the Mission/Bernal Heights has gone through.
author: Neni E.

description: I love this place... it has been a really fun part of my morning routine as far as I can remember... I'm conflicted about yelping great things about them because I always want there to be room at a table for me!  The service is great, the coffee excellent, and I love their free wifi and friendly, neighborhood ice-cream social atmosphere.  I knew the previous owner and he was wonderful I was worried how it would change under new ownership... but these gals are fun and savvy and the place is even better than ever.  OH! and I love their salads... I know how special can a salad be, but really, these gals know how to make a very tasty salad.  I spend half my time down on the Peninsula now but I still make the drive all the way up to the City because I love their coffee and atmosphere.  SMOOCH!
author: Callista S.

description: nice location, open space with lots of tables and windows.  the staff is very pleasant.  and katie's vegan egg sandwich is really delicious!  we'll be back often.
author: kate s.

description: i'm now addicted to the heaveny veggie paninis....i get it with provolone cheese to avoid too much fatty brie...true perfection!
author: Latte Queen W.

description: Across the street from my job, and we all LOVE this place. The previous place, Muddy Waters, had just dreadful coffee and was never busy. Now there is always a line and all the tables are full. They know what they're doing, clearly. Now, if they would only make tea lattes....
author: Esther L.
